quiz.title: Mixed System Applications
quiz.subtitle: Unit 7 Quiz 11: Solving Various Real-World Problems with Systems
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Applying Systems of Equations to Different Problem Types

questions.question: The sum of two numbers is 60. One number is 4 times the other. Which system of equations represents this situation?
questions.explanation: Sum means addition: $x + y = 60$. '4 times the other' means: $x = 4y$ (if x is the larger number).

questions.question: A farm has chickens and cows. There are 50 heads total and 140 legs total. Which system finds the number of chickens and cows?
questions.explanation: Heads: each animal has 1 head → $c + w = 50$. Legs: chickens have 2 legs, cows have 4 legs → $2c + 4w = 140$.

questions.question: Two shirts and three hats cost $70. Four shirts and one hat cost $90. Which system finds the cost of each?
Two angles are supplementary. One angle is 30° less than twice the other. Which system represents this?
questions.explanation: Supplementary angles sum to 180°: $x + y = 180$. '30° less than twice the other': $x = 2y - 30$.

questions.question: A plane flies 900 miles. With a tailwind, the trip takes 2 hours. Against the wind, the same trip takes 3 hours. Which system finds the plane and wind speeds?
questions.explanation: With wind: distance = rate × time → $900 = (p + w) × 2$ → $p + w = 450$. Against wind: $900 = (p - w) × 3$ → $p - w = 300$.

questions.question: You have 20 bills in your wallet (only $5 and $10 bills). The total value is $145. Which system finds how many of each bill?
A mother is 3 times as old as her daughter. In 10 years, she will be twice as old as her daughter. Which system finds their current ages?
questions.explanation: Current: $m = 3d$. In 10 years: mother's age = $m + 10$, daughter's age = $d + 10$, and $m + 10 = 2(d + 10)$.

questions.question: Mix 10% saline solution and 25% saline solution to get 30 liters of 15% solution. Which system finds how much of each to use?
questions.explanation: Total volume: $x + y = 30$ liters. Salt content: 15% of 30 = 4.5 liters salt → $0.10x + 0.25y = 4.5$.

questions.question: A basketball team scored 80 points with 35 baskets (all 2-pointers and 3-pointers). Which system finds how many of each type?
A company has fixed costs of $500 and costs $10 per unit to produce. Revenue is $20 per unit. Which system finds the break-even point?
questions.explanation: Cost function: $C = 10x + 500$ ($10 per unit plus fixed $500). Revenue function: $R = 20x$ ($20 per unit). Break-even when $C = R$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent system-building skills! You can translate diverse real-world scenarios into accurate mathematical systems.
scoreMessages.70: Strong work! You understand how to model different problem types. Focus on identifying key relationships in each scenario.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice identifying: 1) What are the unknowns? 2) What totals are given? 3) What relationships exist between variables?
scoreMessages.0: Start by reading carefully: What totals are mentioned? What relationships are described? Create one equation for each total or relationship given.
